comment: This course is very difficult no matter what, but Dr. B's exams are straight forward without tricky questions. Lecture covers a lot of info, but the study guide helps in knowing what to focus on. There are free response questions on exams, but they're not overly difficult. Attendance is for a grade via TEAMS, but he offers some extra credit.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Tests were not hard, just had LOTS of information in each. Attendance mandatory. No longer records his lectures. Kinda just average, not too terrible and not above and beyond. I feel like he has an inability to "dumb down" some stuff sometimes.

Dr. B is great! Micro is a hard class in general and he tends to ramble a bit during lectures but he is very friendly & understanding. Mastering homework every week & 3 tests (at least for Summer semester) so it's pretty manageable. There is a LOT of material though, so you will be spending a LOT of time studying. Overall great professor!

Dr Battaglioli is super nice. extremely knowledgeable and passionate about micro. his lectures are a little boring at times but he's funny and jokes around. tests are in person on lockdown. homework every week and extra credit at the end that don't count for much. test weren't terrible but its definitely a lot of material.

I feel like Dr. B knew exactly what he was talking about but wasn't the best at relaying information. The tests were very detailed and difficult (inc. fitb, free response, and mcq). All he provided was a vague study guide, which was annoying. 3 exams and a final, attendance, and hw every couple of days. He drops an exam and provides bonus.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Have to buy digital textbook on Day One Access to get hw access. Grades attendance. No quizzes. Surveys = bonus. Can attend in-person or online thru Microsoft. Online lecture recorded. Four exams. Fourth one is the final. Drops lowest exam of the four. A lot of material covered for each exam.

Microbiology is a difficult course, with Dr B he has 3 exams and a final all weighted equally and you drop your lowest exam. The tests are very very dense content wise, so you'll likely have 15-20 hours of content to understand across roughly 10 power points per exam. Multiple choice, multiple select, and free response. Good teacher but tough class

He offers the class to be fully remote. His tests r very difficult, n a large % of the test grade comes from free response questions. He pretends to be super chill, but is strict n a tough grader. A lot of homework given that isn't too bad n can help your grade. Doesn't slow down n covers content that would be on the next exam the class before it.

Dr. B is definitely a really good person. Super knowledgeable and willing to answer any questions he's asked. Graded on attendance, easy homework (even though its awkwardly aligned with lecture) and three difficult tests (plus final) with your lowest exam dropped. If you really want to learn microbiology, 100% would recommend. If not, no.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Really nice professor, really knowledgeable, and ready to answer questions. Class graded on easy homework and 4 hard exams (he drops the lowest grade). You don't need to read the textbook but it makes the homework easier. Offers online participation and engages well with students. Get ready to study, it's a lot of difficult material.
Great guy. He was super understanding and very passionate about what he was teaching. Loves answering questions and very approachable as well.

Dr. B is very nice. He knows the material and is always available to answer questions. The class has a lot of information so I advice to participate and ask questions, because they count as grade and also help during exams for free response. Study the PowerPoints, show up for classes and participate; you will do fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He is the only good microbio professor at KSU. Study the PowerPoints and youll do fine on his tests. He also curves his tests by atleast 5 points. Homework is important as its an easy 100 in the gradebook. Use the textbook if you struggle with homework to get 100s. I got 86s on tests and still have a 95 cause of test curves and easy hw grades.

He is definitely an awesome teacher for this course! You can tell he loves the content that he is teaching and wants us to be interested in it as well. The content is difficult, but that's just because the course itself is hard. Online HW which is easier with the textbook. Exams are a bit hard. He mainly teaches off powerpoints. Take him!

Took the class during the summer as an engineering student, and I dont think he got that not everyone is as excited at bio. He made it seem like you should already know how to think and work like a scientist even if it wasnt your major, which made this class hard for me when you have to make 2 posters for this class in a really scientific way.

Dr. Battaglioli is an amazing professor. He is so smart and passionate about the material he teaches which makes his lectures so interesting. Take him for lecture and lab if you can, he always makes it very clear what you're supposed to be doing. He encourages questions and engagement and never makes you feel dumb. Definitely take him if you can!!

Professor is nice, but not specific test wise. he wont tell you what to study for & he uploads study guides last minute. BUT his test are heavy on the PowerPoint content & the textbook actually helps make sense of some of his slides. tests are not hard, but you do have to study everything. Would take him again!

Basically this class revolves around "homework" which are just quizzes taken on d2l. Attendance from polls during class (online) and tests. If you are good at memorizing powerpoint slides you will make an A. If you ask what you need to know he will answer with "everything's important". Very boring lectures. Class is just straight memorization
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Really sweet guy, responds to emails within minutes, Only 2 tests and the final, but tests are open note. A chill class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: really fair grading. 2 exams+ hw+final. ready the powerpoints and you will do just fine!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT
